title: 114_s2422
content: The Act is titled the "Fiscal Year 2016 Department of Veterans Affairs Seismic Safety and Construction Authorization Act" and authorizes certain major medical facility projects of the Department of Veterans Affairs. The Military Construction, Veterans Affairs, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2016 and the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2016 allocate funds for seismic corrections and construction at the West Los Angeles Medical Center of the Department of Veterans Affairs. The funding allocated includes $158 million for a new research building in San Francisco, $161 million to replace a high-risk building in Long Beach, and $468.8 million for critical construction projects in Kentucky, Missouri, Maryland, and Washington to ensure healthcare access and safety at VA medical facilities. The Department lacks authorization to use allocated funds for major medical facility projects in Perry Point, Maryland, American Lake, Washington, Alameda, and Livermore, California. Three critical seismic safety projects in California are at risk of delays, increasing the threat of building failure in a seismic event. The United States Geological Survey warns that California faces a high risk of experiencing a significant earthquake in the next 30 years. Even smaller earthquakes can be dangerous to seismically unsafe buildings. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs is authorized to carry out seismic corrections to buildings in California, including retrofitting and replacement of high-risk buildings. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs is authorized to carry out seismic corrections in California, including retrofitting and replacement of high-risk buildings, with allocated funds for various projects in San Francisco, West Los Angeles, Long Beach, Alameda, Livermore, and Louisville. Total funding not to exceed $915,842,000. Authorization of Appropriations for Construction.--The Secretary of Veterans Affairs is authorized to appropriate $1,113,802,000 for construction projects in Kentucky, Maryland, and Washington in fiscal year 2016. These projects include a replacement community living center, seismic corrections, renovations, and a specialty care building. The funds must be used specifically for these projects. Authorization of appropriations for Construction includes funds available for Construction, Major Projects, before and after fiscal year 2016, funds appropriated for fiscal year 2016 for activities not specific to a project, and funds for activities not specific to a project in fiscal years before and after 2016. Passed the Senate January 20, 2016. Attest: JULIE E. ADAMS, Secretary.
